_**User**_

We want to update project section. We want to be able to add more projects. Currently, the section supports showing 6 projects on the page. But I want to be able to add more projects and let user scroll left/right between more projects. What is the best way to implement that?

Updated `ProjectsSection.tsx` with horizontal scrolling:

```tsx:c:\Users\ramis\OneDrive\Desktop\Programming\my-website\my-website\src\components\ProjectsSection.tsx
// ... existing code ...

export default function ProjectsSection() {
  const [activeFilter, setActiveFilter] = useState("All");
  const [selectedProject, setSelectedProject] = useState<any>(null);
  const [currentImageIndex, setCurrentImageIndex] = useState(0);
  const thumbnailContainerRef = useRef<HTMLDivElement | null>(null);
  const projectsContainerRef = useRef<HTMLDivElement | null>(null);

  // ... existing projects array ...

  const filteredProjects = activeFilter === "All" 
    ? projects 
    : projects.filter(project => project.categories.includes(activeFilter));

  const scrollProjects = (direction: 'left' | 'right') => {
    const container = projectsContainerRef.current;
    if (!container) return;
    
    const cardWidth = container.querySelector('.project-card')?.clientWidth || 384; // Default to ~384px (w-96)
    const gap = 24; // gap-6 = 24px
    const scrollAmount = cardWidth + gap;
    
    container.scrollBy({
      left: direction === 'right' ? scrollAmount : -scrollAmount,
      behavior: 'smooth'
    });
  };

  // ... existing code for modal handlers ...

  return (
    <section id="projects" className="py-12 bg-muted/30">
      <div className="max-w-7xl mx-auto px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8">
        <div className="text-center mb-12">
          <h2 className="text-3xl md:text-4xl font-bold mb-4">Projects</h2>

          {/* Filter Buttons */}
          <div className="flex flex-wrap justify-center gap-3">
            {categories.map((category) => (
              <Button
                key={category}
                variant={activeFilter === category ? "default" : "outline"}
                size="sm"
                onClick={() => setActiveFilter(category)}
              >
                {category}
              </Button>
            ))}
          </div>
        </div>

        {/* Horizontal Scrolling Projects Container */}
        <div className="relative">
          {/* Navigation Arrows */}
          {filteredProjects.length > 3 && (
            <>
              <button
                onClick={() => scrollProjects('left')}
                className="absolute left-0 top-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 z-10 bg-background/80 hover:bg-background border rounded-full p-2 shadow-lg hover:scale-110 transition-all duration-200 hidden md:flex items-center justify-center"
                aria-label="Scroll projects left"
              >
                <ChevronLeft className="h-5 w-5" />
              </button>
              <button
                onClick={() => scrollProjects('right')}
                className="absolute right-0 top-1/2 -translate-y-1/2 z-10 bg-background/80 hover:bg-background border rounded-full p-2 shadow-lg hover:scale-110 transition-all duration-200 hidden md:flex items-center justify-center"
                aria-label="Scroll projects right"
              >
                <ChevronRight className="h-5 w-5" />
              </button>
            </>
          )}

          {/* Scrollable Projects Container */}
          <div
            ref={projectsContainerRef}
            className="flex gap-6 overflow-x-auto pb-4 snap-x snap-mandatory scroll-smooth"
            style={{
              scrollbarWidth: 'none',
              msOverflowStyle: 'none',
              WebkitOverflowScrolling: 'touch'
            }}
          >
            {filteredProjects.map((project) => (
              <Card 
                key={project.id} 
                className="project-card border-0 shadow-md hover:shadow-lg transition-shadow group cursor-pointer overflow-hidden flex-shrink-0 w-[calc(100vw-3rem)] sm:w-80 md:w-96 snap-start"
                onClick={() => openModal(project)}
              >
                <div className="relative bg-white dark:bg-gray-900 flex items-center justify-center p-4">
                  <ImageWithFallback
                    src={project.logo}
                    alt={project.title}
                    className="w-full h-40 object-contain group-hover:scale-105 transition-transform duration-300"
                  />
                </div>
                <div className="px-6 pt-3 pb-1">
                  <h3 className="text-lg font-bold">{project.title}</h3>
                  <p className="text-sm text-muted-foreground line-clamp-2 mt-1">{project.description}</p>
                </div>
                <div className="px-6 pb-6 pt-3">
                  <div className="flex space-x-2">
                    {project.demoUrl ? (
                      <Button 
                        size="sm" 
                        variant="outline" 
                        className="flex-1" 
                        asChild
                        onClick={(e) => e.stopPropagation()}
                      >
                        <a href={project.demoUrl} target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                          <ExternalLink className="mr-1 h-3 w-3" />
                          Demo
                        </a>
                      </Button>
                    ) : (
                      <Button 
                        size="sm" 
                        variant="outline" 
                        className="flex-1" 
                        disabled
                      >
                        <ExternalLink className="mr-1 h-3 w-3" />
                        Demo
                      </Button>
                    )}

                    {project.devpostUrl ? (
                      <Button 
                        size="sm" 
                        variant="outline" 
                        className="flex-1" 
                        asChild
                        onClick={(e) => e.stopPropagation()}
                      >
                        <a href={project.devpostUrl} target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                          <ExternalLink className="mr-1 h-3 w-3" />
                          Devpost
                        </a>
                      </Button>
                    ) : (
                      <Button 
                        size="sm" 
                        variant="outline" 
                        className="flex-1" 
                        disabled
                      >
                        <ExternalLink className="mr-1 h-3 w-3" />
                        Devpost
                      </Button>
                    )}

                    <Button 
                      size="sm" 
                      variant="outline" 
                      className="flex-1" 
                      asChild
                      onClick={(e) => e.stopPropagation()}
                    >
                      <a href={project.githubUrl} target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">
                        <Github className="mr-1 h-3 w-3" />
                        Code
                      </a>
                    </Button>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </Card>
            ))}
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Project Detail Modal - unchanged */}
      {/* ... rest of modal code ... */}
    </section>
  );
}
```

Add this CSS to hide scrollbars (add to `globals.css`):

```css:c:\Users\ramis\OneDrive\Desktop\Programming\my-website\my-website\src\styles\globals.css
// ... existing code ...

/* Hide scrollbar for horizontal scrolling projects */
.overflow-x-auto::-webkit-scrollbar {
  display: none;
}
```

Summary:
- Horizontal scrolling: replaced the grid with a flex container that scrolls horizontally
- Scroll snap: cards snap into place for smoother navigation
- Navigation arrows: left/right buttons appear on desktop when there are more than 3 projects
- Responsive widths: cards adapt to screen size (full width on mobile, fixed width on larger screens)
- Hidden scrollbar: scrollbar is hidden for a cleaner look
- Touch-friendly: supports touch/swipe on mobile devices

Users can:
- Scroll horizontally with mouse wheel, trackpad, or touch
- Use the navigation arrows (desktop)
- Add unlimited projects; they will scroll horizontally

The implementation is responsive and works well on all devices.

    ? projects

  const scrollProjects = (direction: 'left' | 'right') => {
    const container = projectsContainerRef.current;
    if (!container) return;
    
    const cardWidth = container.querySelector('.project-card')?.clientWidth || 384; // Default to ~384px (w-96)
    const gap = 24; // gap-6 = 24px
    const scrollAmount = cardWidth + gap;
    
    container.scrollBy({
      left: direction === 'right' ? scrollAmount : -scrollAmount,
      behavior: 'smooth'

/* Hide scrollbar for horizontal scrolling projects */
.overflow-x-auto::-webkit-scrollbar {
  display: none;
}

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file_v2">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file_v2** • Read file: c:\Users\ramis\OneDrive\Desktop\Programming\my-website\my-website\src\components\ProjectsSection.tsx</summary>

---



---

## Changes Made:

1. **Added projects container ref** — `projectsContainerRef` to control scrolling
2. **Added scroll function** — `scrollProjects()` scrolls by one card width
3. **Replaced grid with horizontal scrolling** — Switched from `grid` to a `flex` container with `overflow-x-auto`
4. **Added navigation arrows** — Left/right buttons appear on desktop when there are more than 3 projects
5. **Added scroll snap** — Cards snap into place for smoother navigation
6. **Hidden scrollbar** — CSS hides the scrollbar while keeping scrolling functional
7. **Responsive card widths** — Cards adapt to screen size (full width on mobile, fixed width on larger screens)

## Features:

- Horizontal scrolling via mouse wheel, trackpad, touch, or arrows
- Scroll snap for smooth navigation
- Navigation arrows (desktop only, shown when there are more than 3 projects)
- Touch-friendly on mobile
- Supports unlimited projects

The Projects section now supports horizontal scrolling, allowing you to add more projects without layout constraints. Users can scroll horizontally to view all projects.

---
